column5: hi!i was just wondering how i would know if i need a short shaft or a long shaft kiker on my boat.i will be putting on a kiker bracket because i cant mount it on the back of my boat.thanx!

If you have a kicker bracket I would think that any length shaft will do. Depends on the height you mount the bracket at. Just make sure that the steering transfer rod has enough clearence to do the job.
If your transom is 25 inches,you need a long shaft  Consider a kicker bar attached to the big motor
Go with a long shaft... it'll ensure your prop stays in the water when the waves are unpleasent...
